title: Charging - charge separation on sphere near rod

content.description: A solid conducting sphere with zero net charge is sitting on an insulating stand, also with zero net charge, as shown in the figure. An insulating rod with a positive charge is held near the sphere. A student makes the following incorrect claim:
content.question: “Since the sphere is a solid conductor and has zero net charge, it must be electrically neutral everywhere throughout its interior as well as everywhere on its surface.”Which of the following explains why the student’s claim is incorrect?

choices.label: If the sphere were neutral everywhere, it would have an electric field inside it due to the charge on the rod.
If the sphere were neutral everywhere, there would have to be a conductive path between the sphere and ground.
If the sphere were neutral everywhere, the net force on the sphere would be zero and the sphere would float in mid-air.
If the sphere were neutral everywhere, the stand would have to acquire a negative charge to balance the positive charge of the rod.

content.answer: If the sphere were neutral everywhere, it would have an electric field inside it due to the charge on the rod.
